Docs.summary:
This class represents a single item of the project, as it is passed into a task. TaskItems do not exactly correspond to item elements in project files, because then tasks would have access to data that wasn't explicitly passed into the task via the project file. It's not a security issue, but more just an issue with project file clarity and transparency.
Note: This class has to be sealed. It has to be sealed because the engine instantiates it's own copy of this type and thus if someone were to extend it, they would not get the desired behavior from the engine.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem> objects do not exactly correspond to item elements in project files. If they did, then tasks would have access to data that was not explicitly passed into the task through the project file. This is not a security issue, but rather an issue with project file clarity and transparency.
This class has to be sealed since the build engine instantiates its own copy of this type. If a third party were to extend this class, then the build engine will yield an undesired behavior.

Docs.comment: Surprisingly few of these Utilities TaskItems are created: typically several orders of magnitude fewer than the number of engine TaskItems.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IDictionary CloneCustomMetadata() cil managed
abstract member CloneCustomMetadata : unit -> System.Collections.IDictionary override this.CloneCustomMetadata : unit -> System.Collections.IDictionary

Docs.summary: Get the collection of custom metadata. This does not include built-in metadata.
Docs.returns: An that represents a clone of the custom metadata.
Docs.remarks: RECOMMENDED GUIDELINES FOR METHOD IMPLEMENTATIONS: 1) this method should return a clone of the metadata 2) writing to this dictionary should not be reflected in the underlying item.
Docs.comments: Returns an UNESCAPED version of the custom metadata. For the escaped version (which is how it is stored internally), call ITaskItem2.CloneCustomMetadataEscaped.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyMetadataTo(class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem destinationItem) cil managed
abstract member CopyMetadataTo : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem -> unit override this.CopyMetadataTo : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem -> unit

Docs.param: The item to copy metadata to.
Docs.summary: Copy the metadata (but not the ItemSpec) to destinationItem. If a particular metadata already exists on the destination item, then it is not overwritten -- the original value wins.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the metadata already exists on the destination item, then it is not overwritten. The original metadata value supersedes the copied metadata value.
This method does not copy the item specification to the destination task item.

Docs.param: The name of the metadata to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Retrieves one of the arbitrary metadata on the item. If not found, returns empty string.
Docs.comments: Returns the unescaped value of the metadata requested.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object InitializeLifetimeService() cil managed
Public Overrides Function InitializeLifetimeService () As Object

Docs.summary: Overridden to give this class infinite lease time. Otherwise we end up with a limited lease (5 minutes I think) and instances can expire if they take long time processing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Otherwise, a limited lease of 5 minutes will result; and task instances can expire if they take a long time to process.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ItemSpec { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ItemSpec : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the item-spec.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem.ItemSpec%2A> for the following item declaration in a project file is `File.cs`.
```xml <ItemGroup> <Compile Include="File.cs"/> </ItemGroup> ```

Docs.comments: This one is a bit tricky. Orcas assumed that the value being set was escaped, but that the value being returned was unescaped. Maintain that behaviour here. To get the escaped value, use ITaskItem2.EvaluatedIncludeEscaped.
